result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy L Hudson Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy L Hudson Jr appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Kafkas has been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Hudson Jr in court in person.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Hudson in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status Of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

01:29 PM Defendant Jeremy L Hudson in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Jeremy L Hudson in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
